properties.name: Victoria, Canada
properties.title: No clear winner in B.C. election race between NDP, Conservatives

properties.name: Ottawa, Canada
properties.title: National ban on vaping flavours coming 'soon,' says addictions minister::Are Democrats losing Latinos, and the election, to Donald Trump?::Parenting is hard. The '17 diapers' trend gets honest without shame::In 1962, a stranger helped save my dad's life. Meeting him made me more grateful for my own::Juan Soto's home run in the 10th inning sends New York Yankees to the World Series::'No imminent threat' spurred shocking allegations against government of India, says senior Mountie
properties.description: The minister of mental health and addictions says the federal government will ban most vape flavours across Canada soon — more than three years after Ottawa first promised to bring in the regulations.::::It started with a mom on TikTok picking up the 17 dirty diapers she'd left around the house that day. It turned into an online movement where other parents share the realities of postpartum life.::A newspaper photo gave Amy Reiswig the name of a man who’d helped save her father's life more than 60 years earlier. Meeting him allowed her to say thank you, while also giving him a chance to see how just doing his job had such a big impact::Juan Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning and the New York Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series — and first in 15 years — by beating the Cleveland Guardians 5-2 in Game 5 of the AL Championship Series on Saturday night in Cleveland.::Days after the RCMP dropped the bombshell allegation that Indian government agents have been involved in crimes in Canada, a top Mountie said the alleged network of criminals is "unprecedented" but poses no immediate threat to the public.
properties.source: CBC Canada::CBC Canada::CBC Canada::CBC Canada::CBC Canada::CBC Canada

properties.name: Toronto, Canada
properties.title: Why wait to retire? These Canadians are embracing the adult gap year instead::Halal claims exposed; Retailers spending millions on police to combat theft: CBC's Marketplace cheat sheet::What a ruling by Ontario's top court could mean for the future of climate litigation
properties.description: Human resources professionals say Canadian companies are seeing more employees asking to take absences from work that are longer than standard vacation time allows. Some call it a mini-retirement; others refer to it as an ‘adult gap year.’::CBC's Marketplace rounds up the consumer and health news you need from the week.::

properties.name: Abbotsford, Canada
properties.title: Rescuers search for missing person after B.C. mudslide washes away home
properties.description: Rescuers in Coquitlam, B.C., say they are searching for a missing homeowner in the city's Quarry Road area after torrential rain triggered a mudslide in the area.

properties.name: Cincinnati, United States
properties.title: Beloved piano teacher's death sparks call for better drug monitoring in hospitals

properties.name: Charlottetown, Canada
properties.title: How a sick silver fox stole the hearts of a caring P.E.I. couple
properties.description: An eastern P.E.I. couple have developed a special bond with a silver fox they helped nurture back to health.

properties.name: Seoul, South Korea
properties.title: After a week of jaw-dropping accusations, the quaint world of 2015 seems far away

properties.name: Halifax, Canada
properties.title: Former Liberal MP Andy Fillmore elected Halifax's next mayor

properties.name: Cleveland, United States
properties.title: Cher, Dionne Warwick among 2024 class inducted into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
properties.description: Dua Lipa and Cher opened the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony on Saturday night singing Believe, before giving way to a medley of rump shakers by funk masters Kool & the Gang and a powerhouse performance by Dionne Warwick.

properties.name: Havana, Cuba
properties.title: Some of Cuba's power grid slowly flickers on after back-to-back nationwide blackouts::Parts of Cuba get electricity back after nationwide power outage left millions in the dark
properties.description: Cuba's government said on Saturday it had made some progress in gradually re-establishing electrical service across the island, including to hospitals and parts of the capital Havana, after state-run media earlier reported the national grid had collapsed for a second time in 24 hours.::Cuba's government on Saturday said that some electricity was restored on the island after one of the country's major power plants failed and left millions without electricity in an outage that started two days earlier.

properties.name: San Francisco, United States
properties.title: X is the latest social media site letting 3rd parties use your data to train AI models
properties.description: Starting Nov. 15, X will share user data — including posts, likes, bookmarks and reposts — with third-party platforms that may use the information to train AI models.

properties.name: Beirut, Lebanon
properties.title: Israel bombards Beirut and Gaza, claims Hezbollah drone targeted Netanyahu's home
properties.description: Israeli strikes pummelled Beirut's southern suburbs on Saturday as the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah fired salvos of rockets at northern Israel, with one drone directed at Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's holiday home, his spokesperson said.

properties.name: Washington, D.c., United States
properties.title: Trump kicks off a Pennsylvania rally by talking about Arnold Palmer's genitalia::Mail carriers and USPS reach tentative contract that includes raises and air-conditioned trucks::What's behind a recent rise in executions in America after years of decline::Analysis: Why Sinwar's death does not mean a breakthrough in the Israel-Hamas war::Brooks and Capehart on key moments in the 2024 race in the final weeks before Election Day
properties.description: Trump was campaigning in Latrobe, Pennsylvania, where Palmer was born in 1929 and learned to golf from his father, who suffered from polio and was head pro and greenskeeper at the local country club.::Some 200,000 mail carriers have reached a tentative contract deal with the U.S. Postal Service that includes backdated pay raises and a promise to provide workers with air-conditioned trucks.::While the execution of a Texas man was temporarily put on hold this week, more than 2,000 people remain on death row across the country. The Texas case has highlighted a recent increase in executions and prompted questions about how capital punishment is applied in the United States. Maurice Chammah, a staff writer for The Marshall Project, joins Ali Rogin to discuss.::Despite some raised expectations, the killing in Gaza of formidable Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is not likely to hasten a formal cease-fire, nor end Israeli efforts to eliminate the group responsible for the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks.::New York Times columnist David Brooks and Washington Post associate editor Jonathan Capehart join Amna Nawaz to discuss the week in politics, including how the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar could mark a turning point in the war in Gaza, and key moments in the presidential race with less than three weeks to go before Election Day.

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.title: French foreign minister vows support for Kyiv's plan to end Russian invasion of Ukraine
properties.description: Unveiled by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy earlier this week, Kyiv's "victory plan" hopes to compel Russia to end its invasion of Ukraine through negotiations. The proposal is being considered by Ukraine's Western partners, whose help is vital for Kyiv to resist its bigger neighbor.

properties.name: Tel Aviv, Israel
properties.title: News Wrap: Israel continues deadly strikes on Lebanon and Gaza as cease-fire hopes dim::Israel pounds Lebanon and Gaza with airstrikes and says a drone targeted Netanyahu's house
properties.description: In our news wrap Saturday, Israeli airstrikes killed two people in the Lebanese city of Jounieh and more than 50 people in Gaza, striking Boeing workers will vote on a proposed new contract next week, Trump and Harris campaigned in Detroit, Cuba's power grid collapsed for a second time after service started to be restored from Friday's blackout, and Hurricane Oscar formed in the Atlantic.::Israel's government said a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house Saturday, with no casualties, as fighting with Lebanon-based Hezbollah and Gaza -based Hamas showed no pause after the killing of the Hamas mastermind of last year's Oct. 7 attack.

properties.name: Harrisburg, United States
properties.title: A look at the battleground state of Pennsylvania's key races in the 2024 election
properties.description: This fall, Pennsylvania is living up to its name as the Keystone State. Both the Harris and Trump campaigns see the state's 19 electoral votes as key to reaching the 270 needed to win the presidential election, while contests there could also determine control of Capitol Hill. John Yang checks in with Julia Terruso, national political reporter for The Philadelphia Inquirer, for the latest.

properties.name: Atlanta, United States
properties.title: Election officials speak out on the violent threats and stress they've faced since 2020
properties.description: With about two and a half weeks until Election Day, some parts of the country are still looking for people to work at polling places. One reason could be the threats and harassment that's been aimed at election officials since the false claims that the 2020 election was stolen. Current and former election officials from across the country share their experiences.

properties.name: Detroit, United States
properties.title: WATCH: Harris campaigns in Detroit and Atlanta, joined by Lizzo and Usher::WATCH: Trump paces stage in silence for nearly 20 minutes after mic failure at Detroit rally::Harris and Trump court voters, make jabs at each other ahead of early voting in Michigan
properties.description: Vice President Kamala Harris appeared with Lizzo on Saturday in the singer's hometown of Detroit, marking the beginning of in-person voting and lavishing the city with praise after Republican nominee Donald Trump recently disparaged it.::Donald Trump paced his rally stage in silence for nearly 20 minutes Friday night in Detroit after his microphone cut out. Looking frustrated, his back was turned to most of his audience at times.::Both presidential candidates have their eyes on Michigan as early in-person voting starts Saturday in parts of the state. Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris had busy schedules there on Friday. Lisa Desjardins reports.

properties.name: Rome, Italy
properties.title: WATCH: Austin holds briefing at G7 meeting of defense ministers in Naples, Italy
properties.description: The first-ever G7 defense ministers meeting opened Saturday in Naples to discuss hot-button topics, including Ukraine, the Middle East and cybersecurity.

properties.name: Oakland, United States
properties.title: Crews halt fast-moving brush fire in Oakland that burned homes, forced hundreds of evacuations
properties.description: A fast-moving fire fed by strong winds burned two homes Friday and damaged several others in a hillside neighborhood in the city of Oakland, where hundreds of people were ordered to evacuate before more than 100 firefighters stopped the progress of the flames, authorities said.

properties.name: Tokyo, Japan
properties.title: Suspect arrested after Japan's ruling party headquarters attacked with firebombs
properties.description: A man threw several firebombs into the headquarters of Japan's ruling party in Tokyo Saturday, then crashed his car into the fencing of the prime minister's residence, Tokyo police said. There were no reports of injuries.

properties.name: Jerusalem, Israel
properties.title: Hamas, Hezbollah and Israel refuse to back down from conflict after Sinwar's death
properties.description: If the U.S. wants to use the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar as an opportunity for peace, the warring sides are publicly resisting. On Friday, Hamas vowed to keep fighting, Lebanese Hezbollah announced a new phase of its war and Israel announced more military deployments to northern Gaza and the Israeli border with Lebanon. Nick Schifrin reports.

properties.name: Berlin, Germany
properties.title: News Wrap: In Berlin, Biden urges Western allies to continue flow of aid to Ukraine
properties.description: In our news wrap Friday, Biden met with Western allies in Berlin to discuss the wars in Ukraine and the Middle East, a federal judge unsealed nearly 2,000 pages of evidence in Trump's election interference case, safety officials are investigating Tesla's "full self-driving" system, autoworkers in Italy went on their first national strike in 20 years, and Cuba suffered a nationwide power outage.

properties.name: Wilmington, United States
properties.title: North Carolina residents contend with grief, lack of supplies as they rebuild after Helene
properties.description: It's been more than three weeks since Hurricane Helene battered parts of the Southeast. The hardest-hit state was North Carolina, where more than 90 people died, 81 people remain unaccounted for and residents face a long road to recovery. Laura Barrón-López reports from Asheville.
